f8cb92da-3cda-4b55-a5ce-4afa6af98a9c.description: This intermediate English class provides students with grammatical skills such as gerunds and infinitives as well as critical vocabulary for use in the workplace, community and for students transitioning into college-level ESL programs. This course is designed to develop students' reading, writing, listening and speaking skills at a high intermediate level.
f8cb92da-3cda-4b55-a5ce-4afa6af98a9c.name: Intermediate English Level 3 (2C)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Within the Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, & Writing) the student will be able to: 1. Conjugate & use will, be going to & the present continuous to show future actions; 2. Use gerunds & infinitives; 3. Correctly use the simple past & the present perfect; 4. Create tag questions; 5. Convert quotes to reported speech; and 6. To effectively discuss short & long-term goals, interview skills, cultural traditions, workplace communication, housing & natural disasters.
Student will complete a final assessment through Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing) requiring a 70% or better to be successful.

08aba1c3-fe93-40ad-b652-d5da208a6492.description: This advanced conversation (Conversation Level 2) course provides students with idioms and phrases used in everyday American English as well as strategies for discussing topics, expressing opinion and asking follow-up questions. The course is designed to develop students' listening and speaking skills.
08aba1c3-fe93-40ad-b652-d5da208a6492.name: Advanced Conversation (Conversation Level 2)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be able to: 1. Express and provide reasons for their opinion on a given topic; 2. Present information on a topic and answer follow-up questions; 3. Work collaboratively to respond to impromptu speech topics; 4. Use connected speech, reduced forms and natural intonation; 5. Pronounce language more authentically to enhance listener comprehension; and 6. Use a wide range of grammatical structures, words, and expressions.
Student will be holistically assessed to determine if they have satisfactorily mastered the material/met the learning outcomes.
PREREQUISITE: MUST HAVE COMPLETED 2A (Or have an intermediate English proficiency level)

be9dabaf-9a18-4f5b-8363-622c66d3e82a.description: This intermediate English class provides students with grammatical skills such as the future tense and critical vocabulary for use in the workplace, community and as preparation for students interested in transitioning into college-level ESL programs. This course is designed to develop students' reading, writing, listening and speaking skills at the intermediate level.
be9dabaf-9a18-4f5b-8363-622c66d3e82a.name: Intermediate English Level 2 (2B)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Within the Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, & Writing) the student will be able to: 1. Conjugate & use used to; 2. Conjugate & use the present continuous for future actions; 3. Use modals to show probability, certainty & regret; 4. Use transitive & intransitive phrasal verbs; 5. Conjugate & use the present perfect tense with ever & never; 6. Use comparative adjectives; and 7. To effectively discuss educational/career goals, employment habits, travel, & purchasing issues.
Student will complete a final assessment through Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing) requiring a 70% or better to be successful.

4a6e7a0b-d2ec-4d5f-83ba-015200a9eb1b.description: This advanced English class provides students with grammatical skills such as modals as well as critical vocabulary for use in the workplace, community and for students transitioning into intermediate college-level ESL courses. This course is designed to develop students' reading, writing, listening and speaking skills at a advanced level.
4a6e7a0b-d2ec-4d5f-83ba-015200a9eb1b.name: Advanced English Level 1 (3A)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Within the Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, & Writing) the student will be able to: 1. Correctly use gerunds/infinitives with verbs & prepositions; 2. Conjugate & differentiate between the present perfect & the present perfect continuous; 3. Effectively use transitive & intransitive phrasal verbs; 4. Use past modals to show regret/remorse; 5. Form embedded wh- questions; and 6. To effectively discuss personality traits, safety procedures, job training & medical issues.
Student will complete a final assessment through Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing) requiring a 70% or better to be successful.

36cce454-696e-45b0-8021-98999df40bfc.description: This beginner English course provides an introduction to the language. Students in this course develop an understanding of basic English phrases, vocabulary and grammar. This course is designed to develop students' reading, writing, listening and speaking skills at a beginning English level.
36cce454-696e-45b0-8021-98999df40bfc.name: Intermediate English Level 1 (2A)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Within the Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, & Writing) the student will be able to: 1. Correctly use conjunctions 2. Correctly conjugate & use be going to to express future actions; 3. Correctly use and place adverbs of degree & frequency in a sentence; 4. Correctly conjugate & use the present continuous tense 5. Correctly conjugate & use the simple past 6. Use appropriate vocabulary to discuss physical descriptions of people, clothing, chores, repairs, & life milestones.
Student will complete a final assessment through Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing) requiring a 70% or better to be successful.

994e2994-5e56-4e75-b844-b3d8e028b677.description: The course satisfies the requirement for new applicants & renewals. Students learn the powers, duties and obligations of a Notary, how to become a Notary in Pennsylvania, how to identify clients, how to keep accurate records and understand the new requirements under RULONA. Topics covered include: who can be a Notary in PA, what documents you can notarize, when can you notarize a document, where can you notarize a document, why do you notarize a document and how do you notarize a document?
994e2994-5e56-4e75-b844-b3d8e028b677.name: Notary

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Concepts covered include: How to identify clients and keep accurate records and to understand the Commonwealth’s process for applying for a Notary License. Students will learn about the mandatory bond requirement and what insurance is available for Notaries as well as what equipment is needed to complete the duties of a Notary.

The student will learn the duties of a notary which include acknowledgement, oaths, verifications on oath or affirmation, witnessing or attesting a signature, witnessing or attesting a signature, certifying or attesting a copy of depositing, and noting a protest of a negotiable instrument.

5340c552-1300-46b8-97a3-0c86f723fed6.description: This beginner English class provides students with grammatical skills such as the present continuous tense and critical vocabulary for use in the workplace, community and as a foundation for academic courses. This course is designed to develop students' reading, writing, listening and speaking skills at a high beginner level.
5340c552-1300-46b8-97a3-0c86f723fed6.name: Beginning English Level 2 (1B)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Within the Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, & Writing) the student will be able to: 1. Correctly use the articles a/an with singular nouns; 2. Correctly use object pronouns; 3. Accurately use prepositions of direction & location; 4. Correctly use possessive adjectives; 5. Correctly conjugate the present continuous tense & demonstrate an understanding of its use; and 6. Use appropriate vocabulary to discuss jobs, clothing, countries, family, classroom, and home furnishings.
Student will complete a final assessment through Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing) requiring a 70% or better to be successful.

67d0a85e-6774-4d4c-8d18-753eda403d83.description: This beginning conversation (Conversation Level 1) course introduces students to basic, common phrases used in everyday American English. Students are given the opportunity to practice their conversational skills and to develop additional skills, such as asking for clarification. The course is designed to develop students' listening and speaking skills.
67d0a85e-6774-4d4c-8d18-753eda403d83.name: Beginning Conversation (Conversation Level 1)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: PREREQUISITE: MUST HAVE COMPLETED 1A (Or have a high beginner English proficiency level)

The student will be able to: 1. Develop follow-up questions to continue a conversation or ask for more information; 2. Ask for clarification when necessary to enhance comprehension; 3. Use an appropriate rate of speech to enhance listener comprehension; 4. Express their opinion on a familiar topic; and 5. Work together to construct conversations based on real-life situations.
Student will be holistically assessed to determine if they have satisfactorily mastered the material/met the learning outcomes.

7a339379-6087-4b1a-bbeb-d21b499ff6f6.description: This advanced writing (Writing Level 2) course is designed to provide students with a more in-depth understanding of the principles of writing. Students learn to develop topic sentences and to organize their thoughts and ideas into well-constructed paragraphs and short essays.
7a339379-6087-4b1a-bbeb-d21b499ff6f6.name: Advanced Writing (Writing Level 2)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be able to: 1. Correctly identify the important parts of a paragraph; 2. Write an effective topic sentence that contains a topic and a controlling idea; 3. Effectively use transition words to organize information in a paragraph; 4. Write an effective concluding sentence; 5. Use editing strategies to correct and revise work; and 6. Develop writing pieces using the Writing Process.
Student will be holistically assessed to determine if they have satisfactorily mastered the material/met the learning outcomes.

3d14de4f-c112-4d15-9e17-3626d4a68d5f.description: This beginning writing (Writing Level 1) course is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in writing. Students learn the basic syntax of a sentence as well as subject/verb agreement. They develop well-structured sentences and begin to explore the development of paragraphs.
3d14de4f-c112-4d15-9e17-3626d4a68d5f.name: Beginning Writing (Writing Level 1)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be able to: 1. Correctly identify the important parts of a sentence; 2. Write a basic paragraph using correct subject-verb agreement; 3. Write an effective topic sentence for a paragraph; 4. Correctly structure a sentence using a subject, verb and object; and 5. Use basic transition words to organize a descriptive paragraph.
Student will be holistically assessed to determine if they have satisfactorily mastered the material/met the learning outcomes.

2f3c8012-cab8-4218-b7ec-e241868d70fe.description: This beginner English course provides an introduction to the language. Students in this course develop an understanding of basic English phrases, vocabulary and grammar. This course is designed to develop students' reading, writing, listening and speaking skills at a beginning English level.
2f3c8012-cab8-4218-b7ec-e241868d70fe.name: Beginning English Level 1 (1A)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Within the Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, & Writing) the student will be able to: 1. Use the simple present to describe daily activities; 2. Correctly use possessive and subject pronouns to describe nouns; 3. Accurately use prepositions of location and time; 4. Correctly form wh- questions using the simple present tense; 5. Correctly identify singular and plural nouns; and 6. Use appropriate vocabulary to discuss classroom items, family members, money and food.
Student will complete a final assessment through Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing) requiring a 70% or better to be successful.

ca89f6bd-d7c0-4c5f-8a17-f24943381c24.description: Students will utilize innovative techniques to create advanced floral designs. Designs created in this class will demonstrate applied knowledge of the elements and principles. Creations will focus on Contemporary, European and Asian Design. They will learn critical thinking skills and how to edit design applications.
ca89f6bd-d7c0-4c5f-8a17-f24943381c24.name: Advanced Floral Design

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will be able to: 1) Identify those given flower, foliage and potted plants used in commercial floristry.
The student will be able to: 2) Recall the definition of each principle and element of design.
The student will be able to: 3) Identify how each principle or element of design is created and used in floral design.
The student will be able to: 4) Analyze & critique floral designs in order to determine proper use of the principles of design.
The student will be able to: 5) Recall major aspects of color and color theory.
The student will be able to: 6) Determine and implement the most appropriate floral mechanic for completing any of the arrangements.
The student will be able to: 7) Demonstrate the proper techniques for creating well developed principles and elements of design for the required arrangement.
The student will be able to: 8) Analyze given parameters and information, then determine the appropriate style and design shape for complete the assigned design project.
The student will be able to: 9) Identify the types of attaching, binding & foam mechanics and their application to professional floral design.

60eeb414-c981-42b3-b28c-e41803ee0815.description: Students will be able to advance their knowledge and skills in floral design with this intermediate course. They will have opportunities to design larger arrangements using more complex techniques. They will learn to use some of the most common design techniques including: mille de fleur, Biedermeier, phoenix, and waterfall designs.
60eeb414-c981-42b3-b28c-e41803ee0815.name: Intermediate Floral Design

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will be able to: 1) Identify the current floral design “design styles” and the distinguished characteristics of each style.
The student will be able to: 2) Identify those given flower, foliage and potted plants used in commercial floristry.
The student will be able to: 3) Recall the definition of each principle and element of design.
The student will be able to: 4) Identify how each principle or element of design is created and used in floral design.
The student will be able to: 5) Analyze & critique floral designs in order to determine proper use of the principles of design.
The student will be able to: 6) Recall major aspects of color and color theory.
The student will be able to: 7) Design & identify design techniques.
The student will be able to: 8) Determine & implement the appropriate floral mechanics for completing any arrangement.

5151604b-c8c4-42c9-ab44-ad2e5f8e755f.description: This advanced English class provides students with a deep understanding of complex grammatical skills as well as common and important idioms and phrases that are used in American English. This course is designed to develop students' reading, writing, listening and speaking skills at a very advanced level.
5151604b-c8c4-42c9-ab44-ad2e5f8e755f.name: Advanced English Level 2 (3B)

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Within the Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, & Writing) the student will be able to: 1. Identify & use stative verbs; 2. Use the correct verb tense to express complete & incomplete past actions; 3. Form adjective clauses; 4. Identify & use relative pronouns correctly; 5. Demonstrate an understanding of common English idioms & expressions; 6. Correctly use said vs. told to express reported speech; and 7. Correctly formulate unreal conditionals to express wishes or lament.
Student will complete a final assessment through Four Domains of English (Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing) requiring a 70% or better to be successful.

29520c0a-6951-470b-9c4a-e48807bf167b.description: Students will be introduced to the basics of floral designing - how to care and condition fresh flowers to prolong their life, floral design terminology, and various design trends and techniques. Students will learn to arrange in a variety of vases (including but not limited to glassware, plastic, and basket containers) using a wide range of flowers and foliage. At least one arrangement will be made each class. No prior experience necessary.
29520c0a-6951-470b-9c4a-e48807bf167b.name: Basic Floral Design

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will be able to: 1) Demonstrate the proper technique for creating well developed Principle & elements of design for the proper arrangement.
The student will be able to:  2) Analyze given parameters & information, then determine appropriate style & design shape to complete project.
The student will be able to: 3) Identify the types of attaching mechanics, binding mechanics & foam mechanics.
The student will be able to: 4) Treatment, handling & proper care of cut flowers.
The student will be able to: 5) Stem cutting.
The student will be able to: 6) Proper storage procedures.
The student will be able to: 7) Flower conditioning.
The student will be able to: 8) Arrangement of round centerpiece & symmetrical triangle.
The student will be able to: 9) Determine & implement the appropriate floral mechanics for completing any arrangement.
The student will be able to: 10) Identify those given flower, foliage and potted plants used in commercial floristry.

09c6cb2c-81b1-437d-8881-013ebdf91830.description: This course is designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their pronunciation of English. Students in this course are able to practice their pronunciation of sounds in American English and to address specific challenges with respect to accent and pronunciation.
09c6cb2c-81b1-437d-8881-013ebdf91830.name: Pronunciation & Accent Reduction

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: PREREQUISITE: MUST HAVE COMPLETED 1B (Or have an intermediate English proficiency level)

Students will be able to: 1. Demonstrate an understanding the written and phonetic correlation in the English language; 2. Recognize and produce phonemes which are difficult or non-existent in their native language; 3. Demonstrate a more native-like command over intonation; and 4. Recognize and produce various tones of voice to fit various emotional needs.
Student will be holistically assessed to determine if they have satisfactorily mastered the material/met the learning outcomes.

0ff27de9-8cc0-44c5-bbb4-0e8857707009.description: Develop an understanding of basic accounting principles and maintaining accurate financial records critical for all business and nonprofit organizations. You will learn to work with general ledgers, balance sheets, income statements, basic payroll, merchandise inventory, and fraud prevention. This program is designed based on the standards established by the American Institute of Professional Bookkeepers. This course can prepare the candidate for the Certified Bookkeeper (CB) designation.
0ff27de9-8cc0-44c5-bbb4-0e8857707009.name: Bookkeeping Certificate Program

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student should be able to complete all daily, weekly and/or monthly financial record keeping and reporting. This includes payroll, depreciation and inventory as well as periodic financial reports.
The student will be able to implement internal controls processes.

8e9e4f9f-d07c-4533-80e3-bf69bc4ff44f.description: This course has been designed to help you learn about various aspects of the Internal Revenue Code, tax preparation/ representation and prepare for the Enrolled Agent Exam. Part I will include Preliminary Work and Filing Requirements, Income and Assets, Deductions and Credits, Taxation and Advice, Specialized Returns for Individuals.
8e9e4f9f-d07c-4533-80e3-bf69bc4ff44f.name: Enrolled Agent Program - Part 1: Individual

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will have communication skills, customer service, critical thinking, research, technical tax aptitude, tax preparation and planning.
The student will understand filing requirements, gross income, deductions, credits and various tax types.

4c30846a-50b3-4075-aecf-4aca0ced20d7.description: This course has been designed to help you learn about various aspects of the Internal Revenue Code, tax preparation/ representation and prepare for the Enrolled Agent Exam. Part II will include Business Entities, Partnerships, Corporations, S Corporations, Business Financial Information, Sales, Credits, and SE Tax, Specialized Returns for Businesses.
4c30846a-50b3-4075-aecf-4aca0ced20d7.name: Enrolled Agent Program - Part 2: Business

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will have communication skills, customer service, critical thinking, research, technical tax aptitude, tax preparation and planning.
The student will understand business entity types and the tax treatment of partnerships, corporations, exempt organizations and estates.

57bac4c5-0842-41e9-a375-6693c7ea337c.description: This course has been designed to help you learn about various aspects of the Internal Revenue Code, tax preparation/ representation and prepare for the Enrolled Agent Exam. Part III will include Practice and Procedures, Representation before the IRS, Specific Types of Representation, Completion of the Filing Process.
57bac4c5-0842-41e9-a375-6693c7ea337c.name: Enrolled Agent Program - Part 3: Representation

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will have communication skills, customer service, critical thinking, research, technical tax aptitude, tax preparation and planning.
The student will understand tax and correspondence audits, installments, offer and compromise and other tax controversies.

d22e52c5-24c5-4cd8-a24d-03ae1c46c69b.description: All students who have completed the required core and elective class hours are invited to take this final step in receiving their Certificate of Completion for the Floral Design Program. Each week you will be evaluated on a design as you would be in a real AIFD test environment. During the final class you will receive your Certificate from Bucks, your completed evaluation and, if possible, recommendation to move on to the CFD exam.
d22e52c5-24c5-4cd8-a24d-03ae1c46c69b.name: Floral Capstone

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will be able to: 1) Design a Boutonniere for a garden wedding; 2) Design a Triangular sympathy arrangement; 3) Design a Small table centerpiece for a birthday party; and 4) Design a Hand-tied bouquet for a bridesmaid

bdcb204f-91a7-4c9f-b94b-0cc110a2174d.description: This course will prepare students to understand the nature of projects and project management by providing the foundation for understanding the broad concepts of successful initiating, planning, executing, controlling, monitoring, and closing out of projects. Case studies are used to illustrate the principles and tools of project management as a process.
bdcb204f-91a7-4c9f-b94b-0cc110a2174d.name: Foundations in Project Management

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will describe the key project management concepts and their importance to projects and organizations.

The student will be able to describe and demonstrate the project management activities for properly initiating, planning, executing, controlling and closing a project in accordance with PMI guidelines.
The student will be able to explain and apply the main project scheduling concepts.
The student will be able to explain and apply project control methodologies.
The student will understand people-skills for effective project management and team leadership.

skills.name: Project Management Body Of Knowledge (PMBOK) Methodology

dfa36350-9f86-491b-9edf-dd66d903f71b.description: This course is designed to prepare you for pre-employment as a Locomotive Engineer or Conductor candidate at a public transportation provider or freight railroad. The earner of this Badge has successfully completed the basic Railroad course. The learner gained knowledge in NORAC, Hazmat, Safety, and freight operating rules. Also, studied the Federal Railroad Administration rules and regulations, especially, rules pertaining to rest (Hours of service).
dfa36350-9f86-491b-9edf-dd66d903f71b.name: Locomotive Engineer & Conductor Program

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will have knowledge of Railroad structure: parts and layout of the Track: - Different types of equipment both passenger and freight railroads - Varies types of the signals and signal systems, such as ABS, INT, CSS, DCS and PTC.

The student will understand Railroad Assignments and roles (Engineer, Conductor, Assistant Conductor, Dispatcher, Yardmaster, and several different types of management positions). Also, different types of assignments (Yard, Local and Road).

The student will understand the Operating Rules: General rules and regulations - Inspection of equipment and train movement rules - Different types of air test for both trains and engines - Radio and electronic communication rules - Track Car and equipment rules.
The student will understand the different classes of hazmat, switching, placement rules, and FRA restrictions. Also, overview of Emergency Response Guide.

fb46f7c8-90a6-4245-9fb3-92358de2b939.description: This ServSafe training course will prepares you to take the official ServSafe Certification exam. ServSafe training is designed by food service and safety professionals, and it meets the requirements of state and federal laws and regulations. You will learn: the importance of food safety handling, forms of contaminations, hazards in the flow of food, purchasing, receiving & storage of food as well as additional topics.
fb46f7c8-90a6-4245-9fb3-92358de2b939.name: ServSafe

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals who complete the program and pass the accredited certification exam are recognized as Certified Food Safety Managers. This class is delivered in two 4-hour training sessions. The on-line proctored exam, with review will be administered on the third day.

At the conclusion of the training, the student will be versed in understanding the importance of food safety handling. Understanding forms of contaminations, the safe food handler – personal hygiene, hazards in the flow of food - preventing cross contamination, purchasing, receiving and storage, food preparation – thawing and cooking practices, guidelines for serving safe food, food safety management systems, facilities and pest management and cleaning and sanitizing.

aa9907c0-e2ad-4def-82a0-73d596142b87.description: Expand your floral design skills by learning one of the biggest parts of the industry. We will explore all the different ways that floral design is used for funeral and sympathy work. Our designs will be based on the principals and elements of design, and we will be looking at modern trends in sympathy design.
aa9907c0-e2ad-4def-82a0-73d596142b87.name: Sympathy & Funeral Flowers

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will be able to: 1) Identify, by common or Latin names, those given flower, foliage and potted plants used in commercial floristry.
The student will be able to: 2) Recall the definition of each principle and element of design.
The student will be able to: 3) Identify how each principle or element of design is created and used in floral design.
The student will be able to: 4) Analyze & critique floral designs in order to determine proper use of the principles of design.
The student will be able to: 5) Recall major aspects of color and color theory.

The student will be able to: 6) Synthesize given information to be able to complete an assigned design project of an asymmetrical triangle, traditional styled casket spray, diagonal casket spray, easel wreath design, standing easel spray & basket design.
The student will be able to: 7) Determine and implement the most appropriate floral mechanic for completing any of the arrangements.
The student will be able to: 8) Demonstrate the proper techniques for creating well developed principles and elements of design for the required arrangement.
The student will be able to: 9) Analyze given parameters and information, then determine the appropriate style and design shape for complete the assigned design project.
The student will be able to: 10) Analyze given parameters and information, then determine the appropriate style and design shape for complete the assigned design project.
The student will be able to: 11) Identify the different widths of florist ribbon.
The student will be able to: 12) Identify the types of attaching, binding, foam & funeral mechanics and their application to professional floral design.
The student will be able to: 13) Determine the most appropriate floral mechanic for completing a sympathy tribute floral design.

6ad1fe0c-cfe1-476f-8291-40039e02667c.description: From Brides and Grooms, to Moms, Flower Girls and that Great Uncle who's never missed a birthday, we'll walk through the best ways to create all of the personal flowers for the wedding day, along with techniques to add that creative and personal touch for each unique client.
6ad1fe0c-cfe1-476f-8291-40039e02667c.name: Weddings I: A Personal Touch

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

entity.name: Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification

badge_template_activities.title: The student will be able to: 1) Identify, by common or Latin names, those given flower, foliage and potted plants used in commercial floristry.
The student will be able to: 2) Recall the definition of each principle and element of design.
The student will be able to: 3) Identify how each principle or element of design is created and used in floral design.
The student will be able to: 4) Analyze & critique floral designs in order to determine proper use of the principles of design.
The student will be able to: 5) Recall major aspects of color and color theory.

The student will be able to: 6) Synthesize given information to be able to complete an assigned project of an oval centerpiece, hand wired bridal bouquet, foam bouquet holder, hand-tied bridal bouquet.
The student will be able to: 7) Demonstrate proper wiring techniques for given flowers such as clutch wiring, cross-pierce wiring, hairpin wiring & insertion wiring.
The student will be able to: 8) Determine and implement the most appropriate floral mechanic for completing any of the arrangements.
The student will be able to: 9) Demonstrate the proper techniques for creating well developed principles and elements of design for the required arrangement.
The student will be able to: 10) Analyze given parameters and information, then determine the appropriate style and design shape for complete the assigned design project.
The student will be able to: 11) Identify the types of attaching, binding & foam mechanics and their application to professional floral design.
The student will be able to: 12) Identify different types of flowers to wear and flowers to carry.
The student will be able to: 13) Identify the different gauges of florist wire.

c58fa1bd-1f0b-4976-881b-001e5aab919b.description: We're going to the chapel and the church, and the Cathedral! Then we'll explore the techniques and mechanics used to create inspiring reception décor.
c58fa1bd-1f0b-4976-881b-001e5aab919b.name: Weddings II: Ceremony & Celebrations

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Community Education and Professional Certification
